fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user that doesn't have an {{AAID}} properly set on the Instance is added to the Restrictions of a page, the Restrictions dialog won't load.

(!) This scenario is uncommon, but it might happen as a result of a Migration (in case the Migration doesn't properly create a user that is part of a Restriction list).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import a Space that contains a user in this scenario, and that has restrictions granted to this user. 
 # Access the affected page.
 # Click on the restrictions padlock.

h3. Expected Results

The restrictions dialog should load.
h3. Actual Results

The restrictions dialog doesn't load, and an error is displayed:

!image-2021-07-12-19-43-15-295.png|width=455,height=434!

!image-2021-07-12-19-43-32-681.png!
h3. Workaround

Remove the problematic restriction from the *Restricted Pages*:
 # Access the Space.
 # Click on the *Space Settings*, on the sidebar.
 # Navigate to *Permissions* tab, then *Restricted Pages* sub tab.
 # The problematic page will display a restriction granted to an *Unlicensed user*. Click on the padlock next to this entry.
fields.summary: Restricted Pages dialog do not load if broken users are added to the Restrictions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some macros use different formats to render content and not all of them support support the new style background color for statuses.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add “Table Filter and Charts for Confluence” to your instance [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/27447/table-filter-and-charts-for-confluence?tab=overview&hosting=cloud]
 # Create a page, insert a “Table filter” macro and a “Table Excerpt” macro
 # Inside each macro, create a table with a status in one of the table cells.
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The statuses will be rendered with the new style background color.

h3. Actual Results
The statuses are rendered with the old style background color.

The screenshot shows that:
- the first table shows the old style background colors
- the second table shows that just the purple color is not correctly rendered (this is tracked in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-72377)
- the last table shows the expected results in a native table in Confluence
!image-20210630-021729.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Use the ADF (Atlassian Doc Format) as format. This will guarantee that all colors are present and be presented in their most recent representation.

See the Jira documentation for ADF (https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/apis/document/structure/) as well as the ADF utils package (https://atlaskit.atlassian.com/packages/editor/adf-utils) and the ADF playground (https://atlaskit.atlassian.com/examples/editor/editor-core/kitchen-sink).
fields.summary: Certain content formats render purple status with the old style background

fields.description:
Currently, the overview page doesn't have a padlock icon, as others pages have. The padlock icon is where users can quickly check the page restrictions, and, in order to check the restrictions applied to the overview pages, the users must go to ... > Restrictions. 

It would be great to add the padlock icon on the Overview page as we have in common pages, so the users could identify through the UI if there is any restriction applied to the space home page.
 * Overview page: 
!Screen Shot 2021-07-12 at 17.40.22.png|width=695,height=51!
 * Common page:
!Screen Shot 2021-07-12 at 17.42.05.png|width=692,height=140!

h4. Workaround

Currently, a possible workaround would be a user with the necessary permissions to navigate to *Space Settings* > *Permissions* > *Restricted pages* and check if the '*Home*' page is listed there as a restricted page. If so, the same user would check if it is possible to remove all the restrictions applied or add new users with the 'can edit' or 'can view' permission.
fields.summary: Add the padlock icon (Page Restrictions) to the overview page (Space home page)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It would be nice if the user had the ability to archive all of the child pages of a parent page when that parent page is archived. Thus allowing the user to archive all pages in a space.
h3. Workaround

Archive the pages one at a time.
fields.summary: Archive all child pages when parent page is archived

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing text within an existing [Roadmap planner|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-roadmap-planner-macro/] on a page that has an [Excerpt macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-excerpt-macro] at the very first line, it will automatically create a copy of the roadmap, placing it within the Excerpt instead of saving the configuration.

(i) Editing the text within the roadmap while adding it as a new macro will automatically add it to the Excerpt instead of creating a new one as it was not added to the page yet.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page.
 # While editing the page, add the [Excerpt macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-excerpt-macro] on its first line.
 # Right below, add a [Roadmap planner macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-roadmap-planner-macro/].
 # Edit the Roadmap planner macro to change some text in it (the bar, lane, or marker)
 # Tap *Insert* to save the new changes.

h3. Expected Results

The Roadmap planner's configuration should be saved on the Roadmap being edited.
h3. Actual Results

A new Roadmap is created and added to the Excerpt macro's body instead of saving the existing one:



!Excerpt_Roadmap.mp4!
h3. Workaround
 * Create a new line above the Excerpt by hitting Enter/Return;
 * Create a new line above the excerpt and add some text to it.
fields.summary: Editing a Roadmap planner will duplicate it if the page has an Excerpt macro at its first line

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It is possible to use separators on [Table of contents|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-table-of-contents-macro/] on the flat output.
However, on the fabric editor, if you try to use a custom separator, e.g: "." or "***", even the text should appears as it is entered, it defaults the separator to be a bracket.
The same happens to the parens separator.

Brackets and Pipe are working normally.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a fabric page
 # Insert some text and create a few headings
 # Insert the table of contents macro on the page
 # Change the output from list to *flat*
 # Change the Separator from the default brackets to a text or something custom to be used as a separator, for example, a dot: . "."
# Click outside the macro to see that the changes were saved
# Publish the page


h3. Expected Results
The separator would be used exactly as it was entered on the box.

h3. Actual Results
It uses the default separator, brackets.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior for fabric editor pages. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Table of content Separators Parens or "Anything"/custom are not working and default to Brackets Separators

fields.description:
Hi,
 
We need to add more functionality to the People space on Confluence. Now we can search for employees by first and last name. However, in the profiles themselves, we have more filds such as a workplace or position. These fields are also completed, so would it be possible to add the possibility of searching for employees also by these elements? Sometimes we need to search for all people from a given position or working in a specific location.
fields.summary: More functionality in People space - Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

*3LO Auth token stopped working with Confluence attachment files download*

In our app we use 3LO OAuth 2.0 to access Confluence. The token used to work with requests to download attachments (something like [https://drawio.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/680198208/20210623_112824.jpg?api=v2\)|https://drawio.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/680198208/20210623_112824.jpg?api=v2)] with Authorization header (value Bearer 3LO_OAuth_token)

Now, such requests are returning 401 unauthorized. Other requests using the api.atlassian.com/ex/confluence still work with the same token.

Please help as our app stopped working

Copied from: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-2434
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use 3LO OAuth 2.0 token to call API [https://drawio.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/680198208/20210623_112824.jpg?api=v2|https://drawio.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/680198208/20210623_112824.jpg?api=v2)] with Authorization header (value Bearer 3LO_OAuth_token)
 # Look at the response
 # Another request to api.atlassian.com/ex/confluence still work with the same token.

h3. Expected Results

Response code: 200
h3. Actual Results

Response code: 401
h3. Workaround

Unknown
fields.summary: 3LO Auth token stopped working with Confluence attachment files download

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Undo (control + z key) command on nested or indented checkboxes does not work properly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create new page
 # Insert a checkbox
 # Press enter to create 2nd line of checkbox
 # Press tab to indent the checkbox
 # Press enter to create 3rd line of checkbox
 !Screen Shot 2021-07-12 at 13.47.58.png|width=300!
 # Press delete to de-indent the checkbox
 !image-2021-07-12-13-55-15-975.png|width=300!
 # Undo by pressing control + z, and repeat
 !image-2021-07-12-14-03-25-176.png|width=300!
 # After undoing a few times, the parent and child checkbox both will disappear on a single undo command
 !image-2021-07-12-14-03-53-795.png|width=300!

h3. Expected Results

Undoing child checkbox should only undo the child checkbox
h3. Actual Results

Undoing child checkbox removes both child and parent checkboxes
h3. Workaround

(Not a direct workaround) When cursor is on the child checkbox, instead of using undo command, use delete command.
fields.summary: Undo (control + z key) command on nested or indented checkboxes does not work properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sometimes, a content on space A might be pointing to a parent page from space B.
In that case, performing a XML space export for space A will include the space B.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a space that contains contents pointing to a parent page from another space
 # Export that space to XML
 # Import it to another instance

h3. Expected Results
The export should include only a single space

h3. Actual Results
The export will contain entries for two spaces, importing both on the new instance.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Space export may export multiple spaces (regression)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

During a Space import to Confluence Cloud, in case a user is imported without having an {{AAID}} specified, and this user has individual permissions granted on the Space, the Space won't work properly. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import a Space to Cloud, that contains a user in this scenario.

h3. Expected Results

The import should work as expected. 
h3. Actual Results

Even though the Space is imported, it doesn't work as expected.
 * Clicking on the pages in the page tree will result in a *We can't find the page* or *We've hit a snag* error.
 * It is not possible to perform changes on the Space permissions. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Imported Spaces that contain a broken user will break the Space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Converting child page from the old editor to the new editor moves the child page on the page tree without changing parent pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Parent page
 # Create 2 Child Pages (Have one with the old editor and one with the new editor)
 # Ensure that Old Editor Child Page is on top of the page tree under the parent page. (Drag this page to the top position under the parent page and drop it there)
 # Edit the Old Editor Child Page and Covert it to the new editor.
 # Publish the page.
 # You'll notice the page moves to the bottom of the page tree under the parent page

h3. Expected Results

The page should not move in the page tree
h3. Actual Results

The page moves to the bottom of the page tree for the parent page
{panel:bgColor=#b3d4ff}
(i) Additionally, the page title may be duplicated. For example. A page called test might be renamed to testtest
{panel}
h3. Workaround

Manually move the page back to the correct location. Manually change the title.
fields.summary: Converting child page from the old editor to the new editor moves the child page on the page tree without changing parent pages.

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

In Confluence, when adding an attachment to a table via drag/drop, the drop location is ignored and the attachment is dropped to the previous cursor location.

*Steps to Reproduce*

* Create a Confluence page.
* Add a table with at least two rows. Click one cell so that the cursor is showing inside it.
* Find a document to attach from your local files.
* Drag it to a different cell in the table.
* The attachment will not respect the drop location. Instead, it gets dropped to the first cell where the cursor is placed.

*Workaround*

Before drag/drop of attachments, the cursor needs to be positioned in the required table cell.
fields.summary: Dynamic cursor positioning during drag/drop of attachments inside Confluence tables or macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Documentation pages incorrectly suggest to use the {{your-domain.atlassian.net}} instead of the {{api.atlassian.com}} one.

The [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/oauth-2-3lo-apps] is the source of truth and provide the correct option to be used as reference while the documentation is being updated.
h3. Affected documents

This is a list of the known documentation pages that are affected, more will be added as we identify them:
 - https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-group/ 

h3. Expected Results

The correct URL ({{api.atlassian.com}}) is used in the documentation.
h3. Actual Results

The incorrect URL ({{your-domain.atlassian.net}}) is used in the documentation.
h3. Workaround

Replace the {{your-domain.atlassian.net}} with the {{api.atlassian.com}} as required when using the APIs.
fields.summary: Documentation pages incorrectly suggest to use the "your-domain.atlassian.net" instead of the "api.atlassian.net" one

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Emojis are not rendered correctly in Apps (e.g. when exporting a Confluence page) and Macros (e.g. when displaying emojis in a table macro).

The problem started around the end of June 2021. Atlassian native macros are not affected.

 

We have been reproducing the issue on a few apps, but more of them can be affected.
h3. +Scroll PDF Exporter / Scroll Word Exporter app+
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # add an emoji to the page
 # export the page

h3. Expected Results

The emojis are correctly rendered in the exported document.
h3. Actual Results

The emojis are not correctly rendered in the exported document and they appear as broken image.

 
h3. +Table Filter macro+
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # add an emoji to a table
 # use the Table Filter macro

h3. Expected Results

The emojis are correctly rendered in the macro.
h3. Actual Results

The emojis are not correctly rendered in the macro document and they appear as broken image.

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Emojis are not rendered correctly in Apps and Macros (starting from end of June 2021)

fields.description:
In the old editor, sorting the table sorted the numbering columns along with it. So it's possible to restore the table to it initial state by sorting the numbered columns.
In the new editor, the numbered columns are fixed and not sorted even when sorted by a different column header, so if you want to restore the table to its initial state, you will need to reload the page.

It would be great if the new editor have the same behavior as the old editor.
fields.summary: Ability to sort the numbered column along with it when sorting a table in the new editor.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While it is possible to make any word in a page a heading, if you have the word *main* to be used as a heading, upon publishing a page, it creates a blank space between the text that was under the heading "main".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Type the word main (it must be a lowercase)
# Highlight it to apply a heading to the word (any heading size)
# Enter a new line and put some normal text
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The text is under the heading, without any changes from the edit mode to the published view

h3. Actual Results
If it is a lowercase *main* word, it creates a blank space between the heading and the text (or macro/quote).
If the word main used as a heading is not only lowercase letters, the issue does not happens.

h3. Workaround
The issue does not occur if it is used *Main* as a heading (with the initial letter as Uppercase ) instead of *main* (all lowercase letters).
fields.summary: Confluence heading with the lowercase word "main", creates blank space between the text and the heading on Published page view

fields.description: Follow up from https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/how-can-i-get-attachement-img-with-oauth/49628

If you have a Children Display macro in a page. Adding a Table of Contents will automatically include these subpages links in the list. However, the links to subpages are not working.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h3. Expected Results
On Parent page TOC links should be included from display child macro.
Screenshot from old editor:

h3. Actual Results
There is no TOC heading links added.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a .XLSX or .DOCX files internal .XML files are missing the XML version header than uploaded to the Office Macro. A PDF error will be displayed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

There are 2 Options:
{panel}
*Option 1*
 # Have a .XLSX or .DOCX file that's .XML files are missing the XML version header: 
{code:java}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
{code}

 # Attach the file to a Confluence Page
 # Display the attachment through the Office Macro{panel}
{panel}
*Option 2*
 # Create a test.xlsx or test.docx file.
 # Remove the .XML files XML version header (Remove for all of the .XML files)
 # Upload as attachment to a Confluence page
 # Try to display the attachment through the Office Macro{panel}
h3. Expected Results

Should display the .XLSX or .DOCX file as shown without the error.
h3. Actual Results

Shows a similar PDF error:

!Screen Shot 2021-07-08 at 10.37.03 AM.png!
h3. Workaround

There are 2 workarounds:
{panel}
*Workaround 1*
 # Upload the broken files to with MS Excel or Google Sheets.
 # Resave the broken file (This should replace the .XML files version header)
 # Upload the file to the Confluence page as an attachment
 # Display through Office Macro{panel}
{panel}
*Workaround 2*
 # Access the .XML files within the broken .XLSX or .DOCX file
 # Add a version header to all .XML files
 # Upload as attachment to a Confluence page
 # Try to display the attachment through the Office Macro{panel}
fields.summary: Office Macros display PDF error when .XLSX and .DOCX internal .XML files are missing the XML version header

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the [insert the include page macro documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-include-page-macro/], says it is possible to find a page from another space using the following:
 * <spacekey>:My page name. The space key is case sensitive.

However, when inserting a spacekey:pagename it does not work on the fabric editor and there is no results.
It only works when you search for the page.
Additionally, after the first try fails when searching by the spacekey:pagename, the results for the page name only returns after hitting space after the page name to show it on the results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page with the fabric editor
 # Insert the include page macro
# Try searching for a page in another space using on box search page to include spacekey:pagename


h3. Expected Results
Shows up the page desired from the other space

h3. Actual Results
The search does not work. 

h3. Workaround
Search for the page title only, without using the space key:page name.
fields.summary: Include Page macro Page to Include box does not work with the spacekey:pagename search

fields.description:

Page Properties does not populate Table of Content macro

h3. Expected Results

Table of content should be listed inside the page properties macro 
h3. Actual Results

The table of content is not displayed when used with page properties macro
{noformat}
...

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the old editor when the user used included page macro, there will be *Go to included page* option which will bring the user to the included page.

Currently, in the new editor, the option has been removed.
fields.summary: Go to included page option.

fields.description:
*Summary*

When running the API advance search endpoint with CQL to perform a search. There is not way to order by relevance. For reference, here relevance means how many times the keyword shows in the title or body of the page.

*Expected behavior*

We want the search to be able to be ordered by search relevance to the keyword

*Actaul behavior*

Currently, the search doesn't prioritize the relevance of the page.
fields.summary: Have API Advance Search with CQL be able to order by relevance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Upon creating notes and adding images into [Microsoft's OneNote|https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/onenote/digital-note-taking-app?rtc=1], if the user copies these images and pastes them into Confluence pages, nothing happens.

(i) The behavior seems to be intermittent.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In [Microsoft's OneNote|https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/onenote/digital-note-taking-app?rtc=1], create a note and upload images to it.
# Copy these images (CMD/CRTL+C) and paste them into a page while being edited in Confluence (CMD/CRTL+V)

h3. Expected Results

The image should be pasted as it happens with images copied from external sources.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens. As if no content was copied.

h3. Workaround

* Paste the image from OneNote into a [Microsoft Word document|https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/word] and then, paste it into the Confluence page.
* [Upload the image directly to Confluence|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/upload-a-file/]
fields.summary: Pasting images from OneNote into Confluence pages does not work

fields.description:
h3.Summary

By default, the access and interaction for features in Confluence are based on [permissions and restrictions|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/what-are-confluence-cloud-permissions-and-restrictions/].

In some scenarios, although there would have no issues to allow users accessing Confluence, it would be beneficial if they could only edit/perform changes if they are accessing the instance from an authorized device/IP range based on the company's configuration.

(i) similar to how [IP allowlisting works|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access/], but allowing the user to see the content even from an unauthorized device.

h3.Suggestion

This is a suggestion to prevent specified features to become interactable if the user accesses the instance from an unauthorized device/IP range. 

For example, the user would still be able to view Confluence based on the user's access granted to the instance, but become a read-only account if accessing Confluence from an unauthorized device/IP range.
fields.summary: Permissions and features based on IP ranges/authorized devices

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a legacy page that contains elements unsupported by the new editor, the following message appears;
{quote}Some page elements aren't supported in the new editor
{quote}
If you don't want to convert to the new editor, there should be some way to dismiss the warning permanently.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the legacy editor template.
 # Add a macro that [we removed from the new editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html] or nested macros.
 # A message at the bottom should appear, _Some page elements aren't supported..._

h3. Expected Results

There should be an ability to dismiss the message.
h3. Actual Results

Every time someone edits the page, a message appears warning about the unsupported page elements.
h3. Workaround

There's no workaround for teams who need to use those discontinued macros.
fields.summary: Ability to dismiss "Some page elements aren't supported in the new editor" message

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, there is no way for Admin to get information about JSM usage on confluence.

Admin would like to get the following information on confluence:
* what are the search patterns?
* Deep dive in search results, which articles were accessed through search vs browse vs through ticket (from JSM)/direct link
* article rating results (thumbs up/down) report
* article views (solved through analytics)

fields.description:

 # Step 2 Select iCal or any calendar app

h3. Expected Results
User should be able to subscribe without any error. 

h3. Actual Results
User is getting error "Error fetching subscribe URL"

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attachments like Word, Excel, HTML, PDF have an "X" symbol in page edit mode to remove attachments.

Deleting attachments using X symbol doesn't work.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Add Excel, Word, PDF or HTML attachment
 # Publish the page
 # Edit the page again and try to click "X" symbol
!Screen Shot 2021-07-07 at 1.42.30 pm.png|width=517,height=219!

h3. Expected Results

Attachment should be removed when clicking X symbol
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happen, you can click a few times and attachment is never removed.

You can use backspace to remove an attachment.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The PNG/JPG images generated from the Chart Macro do not appear as sharp as Text or other Higher Resolution Images on the page 

h3. Suggested Solution
Render the Chart Image in a higher resolution or, render the chart as a vector image so that if the page is zoomed/scaled or viewed on high resolution/large format displays, the chart still has sharpness 

h3. Why this is important
The Chart Macro Image should remain sharp regardless of zoom/scale or screen resolution

h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Increase the Resolution of Chart Macro Images

headlines that are in an excerpt include macro are not displayed in the content macro.

h3. Expected Results

TOC should list Heading from the Excerpt include macro 
h3. Actual Results

TOC does not list Headings from Excerpt include macro.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleting inline comment generates an error message in the UI but the comment is deleted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page
# Add inline comments into the page
# Ask a user with View page, and Add/Remove comments permission to delete an inline comment

h3. Expected Results
The comment is deleted.

h3. Actual Results
The UI shows a pop-up error saying _"*Unauthorized Action*. You can't perform that action on inline comments in this space. A space admin can modify your permissions."_ However, if you refresh the page, the comment was deleted.

h3. Workaround
Currently, the only way to not display the error is giving Add Page space permission to the users.
fields.summary: Deleting inline comment generates an error message in the UI but the comment is deleted

fields.description:
Currently, the Labels Gadget macro will maintain the widith size which it is setting for regardless of the content that is inserted on it and the page size.

Most of the time it is displayed strangely and does not fit the rest of the page and to the inserted content.

It would be best if a responsive option is implemented so the macro can auto-adjust its size so it can be better displayed and organized across the page.
fields.summary: Make the Labels Gadget more responsive to his own content and page size

h3. Actual Results

"Firefox could not install the search engine from: https:/instance.atlassian.net/wiki/opensearch/osd.action"

!Screen Shot 2021-07-05 at 2.02.56 PM.png|thumbnail!

While editing any page in confluence the notification emails are rendering tiny URLs of the pages linked instead of the page titles.

 # Edit the page and publish.

h3. Expected Results

Page titles should be reflected in the notification email.
h3. Actual Results

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

fields.description:
Currently we are having option in page restriction - *Only specific people can view or edit*

Can we have one more option - *Specific people cannot view or edit*

Situation-We have to share 1 page out of 10 pages with the customer.

Explanation - In order add above restriction, we have to add restriction to all 10 pages (list all user groups under *Only specific people can view or edit*) and add permission to customer for that one page through page restriction.

 

To simplify this, can we have option *Specific people cannot view or edit.* so instead of adding all user groups to restrictions for 10 pages we can restrict pages for that single customer.
fields.summary: Page level restrictions

fields.description: An improvement request for image captions: show them when moving through the images in fullscreen. Thanks!
fields.summary: Show image captions when moving through the images in fullscreen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Apps cannot render the purple color status because it is missing from some formats.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an app (e.g. by using the {{export_view}})
 # Add the purple color status to the content of the macro

h3. Expected Results

The purple color status is correctly rendered in the same way as it is rendered when adding it to the page directly:

!image-2021-07-05-10-26-52-863.png|width=136,height=71!
h3. Actual Results

The purple color status is rendered as grey:

!image-2021-07-05-10-27-13-022.png!
h3. Workaround
Use the ADF (Atlassian Doc Format) as format. This will guarantee that all colors are present and be presented in their most recent representation.

See the Jira documentation for ADF (https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/apis/document/structure/) as well as the ADF utils package (https://atlaskit.atlassian.com/packages/editor/adf-utils) and the ADF playground (https://atlaskit.atlassian.com/examples/editor/editor-core/kitchen-sink).


h3. Notes
The https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-72473 ticket is a request to provide a documentation for the ADF.
fields.summary: Apps cannot render the purple color status because it is missing from some formats

fields.description:

Only the webItem specified in the connect.json is presented.

h3. Actual Results

An additional and unexpected webItem called "Unrestricted" is presented.

 

See screenshot for reference:

!image-2021-07-02-14-11-16-570.png|width=656,height=52!

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

An option could be to use a different location but there isn't any other option when editing a page.

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to copy the link to a heading, if the same is inside a numbered heading macro.

This suggestion is to allow the ability to copy the heading link easily, as it works on most native macros, without having to insert the heading outside of the macro, so it would be to get its links.
fields.summary: Allow link to headings to be copied from within Numbered Headings/macros

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user without the necessary permissions to interact with the Confluence Questions app (I.E. * Space Permissions* > *Add-on* > *Questions*) tries to accept an answer, the following message is displayed, which does not clarify what is the root cause for the issue:

!accept_answer.png|thumbnail!

{quote}
*Accept answer didn't work*

We're not sure what caused the problem. Check your internet connection and try again.
{quote}

h3. Suggestion

Similar to the message when the user tries to upvote an answer, this is a suggestion to improve the message so it clarifies that permissions are necessary to perform such action. 

For example:

!upvote_answer.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve messaging for Confluence Questions permissions when accepting an answer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

To allow users to interact with the Confluence Questions app (such as upvoting and accepting an answer), the user and the [Confluence Questions app account should be added to the space permissions|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/what-are-questions-permissions/].

(i) The user and groups that will allow the account to interact with it should be added to the *Add-on* tab under the *Permissions* configuration of the space as well.

If the app's account is already added to the space permissions and then, under the *Add-on* tab, the user account is added individually to the permissions (not via groups), the user will still not be able to interact with the answers.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Confluence instance that has Confluence Questions installed, access a space.
 # Go to the space permissions via *Space settings* > *Permissions* and select the *Add-on* tab.
 # Add the user individually to the permissions, granting all of them:
 !question_perm.png|thumbnail!
 # Have the user trying to upvote or accept an answer.

h3. Expected Results

As the user has permission granted, the account should be able to accept or upvote the answer.
h3. Actual Results

The user is not able to upvote or accept an answer and the following messages will be displayed:
{quote}*Accept answer didn't work*

We're not sure what caused the problem. Check your internet connection and try again.
{quote}
{quote}*Unauthorized action*
 You're not allowed to perform this action. Ask your admin to grant you permission.
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Add the user's group to the *Add-on* permissions tab for Questions.
fields.summary: Adding individual user permissions for the Questions app will not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding an email reminder to our events within our calendars is a great way to make sure we won't miss that important appointment we have scheduled. 
Apparently, this option throws a random error in case no reminder time is set to our event types, letting us without any clue on what to do to fix it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any space and access the *Calendars* option;
# Create a new calendar;
# Refresh the page and create an event in this calendar;
# Hover the mouse over the *Events* option at the left bar, under the calendar you created, click over the *ellipses > Add email reminder*.

h3. Expected Results
If there is no reminder time before the event set in the event types, provide this info as an error message in the UI, stating that the time range to remind about that event prior to it happens needs to be set.

h3. Actual Results
An error message with a hash error saying to contact support.

*Notes*
* Neither the logs are cleared in what to do:
{code:xml}
         error: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
         errorHashCode: 42bcav
         pageName: SPACE_CALENDARS
         releaseId: CLASSIC-master-7268
         shard: confluence-prod-us-1-3.prod.atl-paas.net
         ssrRendered: false
         stack: TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
    at https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/92367.NjFig5mrGr.js:17:148067
    at Xi (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors.N1z3p3QZwS.js:2:562248)
    at xs (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors.N1z3p3QZwS.js:2:608298)
    at mu (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors.N1z3p3QZwS.js:2:601040)
    at vu (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors.N1z3p3QZwS.js:2:600965)
    at su (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors.N1z3p3QZwS.js:2:597995)
    at https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors.N1z3p3QZwS.js:2:549636
    at t.unstable_runWithPriority (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors.N1z3p3QZwS.js:2:779685)
{code}

h3. Workaround
If you face this error, refresh the page, hover the mouse over the calendar you created and click over the calendar *ellipses > Event Types*, then set up the reminder time in each of the events. 
After that, you will be able to create the email reminder.
fields.summary: Hash error when trying to create an email reminder to a calendar

fields.description:
Currently the only option to see if the page is enabled with public link is to visit the page.
It is good to have a option for site admins to see all pages in one place where public link is enabled. It could be on global level or space level.
fields.summary: Option to see all pages where public links is enabled

fields.description:
Currently, the public links option is only enabled at the site level.

It would be great if we have an option to enable and disable public links based on permissions for the users.
fields.summary: Option to grant / revoke the Permission to activate public links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the {{/wiki/rest/api/search/user?cql=type=user}} API, any unlicensed or revoked accounts are not returned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run the {{/wiki/rest/api/search/user?cql=type=user}} API to confirm how many users are returned
 # Revoke or unlicense a user
 # Run the {{/wiki/rest/api/search/user?cql=type=user}} API again

h3. Expected Results

The revoked or unlicensed users are returned by the API with the same level of details that were returned in step 1.
h3. Actual Results

No details of revoked or unlicensed users are returned.
h3. Workaround

The Confluence Cloud Users API ([https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-users/#api-api-user-get)] provide all the required information in case of revoked users. These can be used as an alternative.

 

Notes
Deleted users cannot be returned by REST APIs because of GDPR reasons. See the [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/profile-visibility/] page for more details (the page has been written with Jira in mind but similar concepts apply to Confluence).
fields.summary: The "rest/api/search/user" does not return the details of unlicensed users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Apps are able to declare dynamic content macros with custom editors, however, some testing shows the standard macro editor is sometimes shown instead of the app's custom editor.

This issue was raised from [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/default-macro-editor-rendered-the-first-time-instead-of-custom-editor/49357] which includes a screen recording displaying the issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an app that provides a dynamic content macro with a custom editor and declares on macro input parameter. For example, use the app [https://glitch.com/edit/#!/dx-custom-macro-editor-app?path=connect.json%3A20%3A32,] which can be installed from [https://dx-custom-macro-editor-app.glitch.me/connect.json].
 # Insert the macro in a page.
 # Open the macro in edit mode and observe which editor is display;- Confluence's standard macro editor or the app's custom editor.
 # Repeat steps 2 to 3 as necessary.

h3. Expected Results

At step 3, the app's custom macro editor is always shown.
h3. Actual Results

At step 3, the standard Confluence macro editor is sometimes shown.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Custom dynamic content macro editor not reliably shown

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The feature that allows us to import iCal from Google and Outlook, for example, is a great feature that makes us have more integration and visibility of our daily tasks, improving the way we work in our company and with our teams.

h3. Suggestion
Though this feature is great, when we want to get the subscription configured, customized, or even changed, it is not possible to do this. Ideally, we should have options to:
* Rename the calendar;
* Change the iCal link, in case there is the need to resubscribe to it;
* Change the color of the events on that calendar.
fields.summary: Edit external calendar subscription

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the [REST API to get user accountIds|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-users/#api-api-user-bulk-migration-get], it is not retrieving the AccountId value for the account where the username is used.

For example:

{code}
https://myinstance.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/user/bulk/migration?key=my_username
 https://myinstance.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/user/bulk/migration?username=my_username'
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Use an API tool, a terminal or a browser tab so you can use the API.
# Adjust it according to your current "username" or "key" parameters.
# Run the API call.

h3. Expected Results
The result should retrieve the user's Atlassian Account ID.

h3. Actual Results

Only the username used in the call will be retrieved without the Atlassian Account ID information. For example:

{code}{"results":[{"username":"my_username"}],"start":0,"limit":200,"size":1,"_links":{"base":"https://myinstance.atlassian.net/wiki","context":"/wiki","self":"https://myinstance.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/user/bulk/migration?username=my_username"}} {code}


h3. Workaround

[Export the users|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/export-users-from-a-site/] to retrieve the Account ID for each of the users within the instance.
fields.summary: REST API to get user's Atlassian account ID works intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Include macro breaks if the page title contains a colon  or dash (:  or -)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Page A and B:B or B-B
 # Edit Page A and add include macro; add page B:B in the macro
# Publish page A.
# The macro throws the error 'Error Rendering macro 'include': null'.


h3. Expected Results
The page should render well

h3. Actual Results
The page doesn't render well, the error shows up

h3. Workaround
Remove colon or dash from the title
fields.summary: Include macro breaks if the page title contains colon or dash (: or -)

fields.description:
h4. Current Scenario

When working with the API, sometimes the responses include extra information that might not be relevant for the user.

For example, when using the [Get Content REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content/#api-api-content-get], user might be interested in just getting the page's body, but the response include several other things that are not relevant for the user's use case.
h4. Proposed Solution

Add the ability to include or not the extra information on the response.
fields.summary: Improve the responses for the API calls

fields.description: It would be good to have an API that could get the page tree of the Space, or even related to a specific page (all pages under a specific page, for example).
fields.summary: Ability to get the Page Tree using the API

The user seeing a blank page when clicking on *tap to load* option on a page on the confluence mobile app.

 # Add filter result Macro or Roadmap planner to a page
 # Install confluence cloud mobile app

h3. Expected Results

The user able to view the macro

h3. Actual Results

The user seeing a blank page

Use mobile browser

fields.description:
Currently, when we create an issue from the confluence page, the page will be linked to the issue created. Users have to manually search for the issue on the Confluence page.

 [^Create issue from Confluence page.mov] 

*Suggestion:*

It would be nice to include an ability to use an anchor link to link the Confluence page to the Jira issue.
fields.summary: Add the ability to create an anchor link while creating issues from the Confluence page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On page using the legacy editor, if a user does not have the space permissions to see the page, or the page is restricted and the user is not able to access the page as well, when editing the page, the text title for the link will be automatically changed to /wiki/spaces/<spacekey>/pages/<pageID> and published automatically with it, instead of just showing this URL for the user, but it actually changes the text in the page, and users who have permissions to see the page, will see the title /wiki/spaces/<spacekey>/pages/<pageID>, causing confusion among the users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page using the legacy editor
 # Insert a Page Link from another space
 # Publish the page
 # Make sure to have no space permissions on the space where the page link was from
 # Refresh the published page

h3. Expected Results

The page title doesn't change for the users who have permissions to see the page and the page published does not change the link.
h3. Actual Results

The page title changes if the user has no space permissions on the space where the URL is, the title is also not shown, only the pattern /wiki/spaces/<spacekey>/pages/<pageID> appears instead.
h3. Workaround

It only happens if the text link for the page was never edited in the link macro. To avoid it to happen, you can click on the link, click on edit in the link macro and insert the page title and publish.
fields.summary: Upon editing pages, if a user does not have permission to see a page linked, the URL link title changes to /wiki/spaces/

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a Confluence Cloud customer I'd like to be able to highlight text and create an inline comment in Confluence. In cases where content on a page isn't unique I get an error which prevents me from creating an inline comment.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add multiple instances of the same text to a page
 # Highlight one instance of that text and try to create an inline comment

h3. Expected Results

Inline comment is created on the highlighted text
h3. Actual Results

Receive an error message and I'm not able to create an inline comment
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Only highlight and create an inline comment on distinct or unique text on a page
fields.summary: Unable to create an inline comment on duplicated (not distinct) text on a page

fields.description:

When exporting a page to WORD. The .JPEG and .PNG files will appear blank when downloaded to a MacOS device. However, when downloaded to a Windows OS device the images appear.

(!) Must perform on a MacOS device
{panel}

 # Export the page to WORD

 # Open in Mac Word version

h3. Expected Results

Images should appear on a .DOC export on MacOS devices
h3. Actual Results

Download the WORD export to a Windows Device
fields.summary: Exporting to Word images are missing on MacOS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary Updating a page via REST API causes 501 error.  h3. Steps to Reproduce # Try to update the content with the Update API request: {code:java} curl -u 'USER:API-KEY' \ -X PUT \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ -d'{"id":"924844033","type":"page","title":"Test Worked","space":{"key":"MOV"},"body":{"storage":{"value":"

This is the updated text for the new page for this test v2

","representation":"storage"}},"version":{"number":4}}' https://SITE-NAME.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/924844033 | python -mjson.tool {code} # You'll get the below error message: {code:java} {     "message": "com.atlassian.confluence.internal.synchrony.ExternalChangesException: Trying to access unreconciled content 924844033. Retry in a few moments",     "statusCode": 501 } {code} h3. Expected Results The page is updated accordingly. h3. Actual Results A 501 error is received and the page is not updated. h3. Workaround There are multiple possible workarounds that can be tried: # Run the call again # Navigate to the page # Reach out to Support # Add _?status=current_ at the end of the endpoint
fields.summary: API Update content call shows 501 error message

fields.description:

Steps to Reproduce # Open an Attachment for a page in View mode. # From top right corner option to share the attachment h3. Expected Results The form should be displayed with buttons like submit etc h3. Actual Results Broken The form is in this format {code:java}
Cancel
{code} h3. Workaround No
fields.summary: Attachment can't be shared because sharing layer is broken

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Markup renders TOC correct on the first page, when switching page the TOC is not updated anymore and shows the wrong TOC on the new page.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create  2 page withm multiple header on the page
 # Added the below markup to Space Settings < look & feel < header
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Confluence is integrated with Team Calendars, users have the option to [Subscribe to Team Calendars from third-party calendars|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/take-the-team-calendars-quick-tour/].

If a user tries to subscribe to a calendar in a space, but did not create any calendars within any Confluence space, an "Error fetching subscribe URL" message will be displayed:

!subscribe_error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have "User A" going to a space and selecting the *Calendars* option from the sidebar
# There, the user must tap the *+* icon at the *Calendars* sidebar and then, *Add new calendar*
# Have "User B" going to the space where the calendar was created and select *Calendars* from the sidebar as well.
# Now, this user must tap the ellipsis button at the right side of the title of the created calendar and then, *Subscribe*
# Under the *Calendar app* field, tap the dropdown and select any option

h3. Expected Results

The user should see the steps and URL to be copied so then it could be pasted into the third-party calendar.

h3. Actual Results

An error message is displayed:

!subscribe_error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

* Have the user creating a test calendar in a separate space (a personal space, for example) so the subscribe option will work.
* Have the user watching a calendar (Tap the ellipsis button on a calendar > *Watch*) which will allow the function to work.
fields.summary: Subscribing to calendars will not work if the user does not have a calendar created

fields.description:
*Use Case*: As a Designer, I work with Product Managers and Developers to build epics for upcoming features. We do this in a common document/page in Confluence, before UI Designs are made or code is written. Sadly, we can't see each other's edits as they're being made (until an editor hits Save). This necessitates a Zoom video environment where a screen is shared, and hinders true collaboration - because we can't both be making changes & seeing the others' changes at the same time. Collaboration tends to thrive better if done in real-time.

 

*Precedent*: Google Docs (see video link below)
 * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b4wF58sbzPU]
 * What to mimic: multiple people can edit a Google Doc at the same time, and their changes are autosaved. This would help with collaboration tremendously.

*Another Precedent*: Figma "Multiplayer" mode (see video link below)
 * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zj163lgt_kI&t=189s]

 

*I should be able to accomplish these steps*:
 # Log into Atlassian.
 # Navigate to a "page" where an epic is housed.
 # Edit the epic easily by clicking into fields (without having to enter the global "edit" mode).
 # Have my changes autosaved immediately.
 # If a collaborator is editing the same document at the same time, I should be able to see the changes they make in real-time, as they are being typed (without having to hit the "Save" button manually.)

 

*Other nice-to-have features*:
 * "Follow" mode, where the view window screen automatically follows the view window of another user (See Figma) while they're working, so I can see what they see in real-time within Confluence.
 * A page outline with section headers to know where you are on the page (epics can get very long).
 ** Precedent: [https://material.io/components/app-bars-bottom] Watch the "Content" list on the right side as you scroll down. The header corresponding to the visible section is styled with a heavier weight (*bold*) and it is "sticky" to remain visible as you scroll.
fields.summary: Live Editing of Confluence Epics (Pages) with Multiple Simultaneous Editors

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While it is possible to edit files with Companion, save and then it is uploaded the new version on Confluence, when we go back to the page, when checking the attachment on the page, it shows a "Failed to Load", instead of the preview.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Upload an attachment in the page, eg: .doc .docx, .xls or .rtf 
# Make sure the Companion App is open
 # Go to the attachments page and click on Edit on the attachment uploaded
# Edit it with the companion app > editor (Office word or text file for example)
# Make the edit and hit save 
# Upload the new version edit by clicking on Upload in the companion dialogue
# Clicking on the ">" button to show the attachments versions, you will see a new version was uploaded
# Go back to the page to see the changes

h3. Expected Results
The preview for the file is available and the changes on the version were applied.

h3. Actual Results
Failed to load is shown on the attachment

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Attachments on a page are showing "Failed to load" after it is edited/uploaded with Companion

fields.description: Apps can register webhooks for page_copied events. A use case exists where the app needs to access the copied page in order to query the original context and perhaps copy that if it is not included in the new page (e.g. page properties). However, the page_copied event does not include sufficient information to allow the app to access the original page. It is therefore suggested that the page_copied event payload be augmented with the ID of the page that was copied.
fields.summary: Additional data required for page_copies events

h3. Issue Summary

Apps can define icons associated with their dynamic content macros. The legacy Confluence editor displayed these icons for all combinations of outputType and bodyType, but the new editor only shows the icons when the bodyType is "rich-text".

!v2-editor.png!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When spaces or global templates are using the legacy editor, there will have an option to convert it so they can use the current/new editor of Confluence.

Depending on how the edit mode for them is structured, a different result will happen, but, the template will not get converted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Make sure to have templates that were created with the legacy editor.
# On a space that has the template, the *Convert* option should be displayed.
# Tap the *Convert* button and confirm the conversion after the preview.

h3. Expected Results

After the preview and confirmation, the template should be converted to the new/current editor.

h3. Actual Results

* If tapping the *Edit* button of the template redirects to the legacy editor mode (https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/templates2/editpagetemplate.action?entityId=ID_HERE&key=SPACE_KEY), upon tapping the *Convert* button, a message stating that the conversion has worked will be displayed, but the template will still use the legacy editor:
!success_template.png|thumbnail!
* If the edit mode automatically has the template in the new/current editor (https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACE_KEY/templates/edit/TEMPLATE-ID), upon tapping the *Convert* button, a message stating that the template could not be found will be displayed:
!not_found.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

* For the scenarios where the "edit" button redirects to the new/current editor, use the "Edit" button and publish the template, which will convert it to the new editor.
* For the scenarios where the "edit" button will redirect to the legacy one, manually re-create the template using the current/new editor
fields.summary: Converting a template from the legacy to the current editor will not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For specific scenarios, if an instance has a huge number of labels added to different pages across different spaces, some of them will be missing from the "All labels" list, which can be found in the following URL:
{code:java}
https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/labels/listlabels-alphaview.action {code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(i) This bug seems to be triggered only if the instance already had a lot of labels added. If all new labels are being added recently, they seem to be properly included in the list.
 # Make sure to have a lot of labels already added to the site (1k+, for example) and in different spaces.
 # Tap any existing label while accessing a page so it will redirect you to the label page.
 # Tap the cog icon at the top right and select *All Labels*:
!labels_list.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

All existing labels on the site should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

Only specific labels are added to the list.
h3. Workaround

If you know where some of the labels are added, you can access the list of labels within the space itself. For example, where "key" is the space key:
{code:java}
https://test.atlassian.net/wiki/labels/listlabels-alphaview.action?key=<SPACEKEY>{code}
fields.summary: Some labels are not listed on the "All labels" page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some URLs that contain parameters such as "{"."(" or space are interpreted by confluence as text content, which can lead to a broken link or make it shorter when copying and pasting.

Exemple: https://Externaltestsite/test/?testhashl={{ test.parementer }}&test={{ test.parementer}}&testparementer={{ test.parementer }}&test={{ test.parementer }}test={{ test.parementer }}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to insert like the one above into a confluence page, which can be posted directly or embed with a text,

h3. Expected Results
Confluence should consider all the URL parameters and not change it.
h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-16 at 5.28.41 PM.png|thumbnail! 
The URL got changed and in some cases broken, which also impacts its functionality when try to copying it and pasting it on other pages.

h3. Workaround

Change all the characters to their URL Encode format, like { to %7B or spaces to %20

Example:
https://Externaltestsite/test/?testhashl=%7B%7B%20test.parementer%20%7D%7D&test=%7B%7B%20test.parementer%7D%7D&testparementer=%7B%7B%20test.parementer%20%7D%7D&test=%7B%7B%20subscriber.first_name%20%7D%7Dtest=%7B%7B%20test.parementer%20%7D%7D
fields.summary: Confluence is interpreting URL parameters as text content

File preview should be opened in both the cases

If you try to import a site export from a confluence site to a space import option from the UI, the msg that is shown isn't very clear. 

The message currently states that "Only confluence space exports can be imported". This could be worded better to something like "Looks like the backup you tried to import is a site export and not a space export. The space import option in the UI can only import space exports. In order to import a space, please generate a space export from your source site and try again"

fields.description:
Currently Confluence backups (site and space exports) get generated with a name Confluence-export.zip. 
It would be great if these could be names as follows

* Site Export - Confluence-export.zip
* Space export - Confluence-space-export-<spacekey>.zip

This will make it easier for end users to know what data has been exported without having to review the contents of the file.

fields.description:
*Description:-*

Currently, when you create a Confluence Jira macro the units are always shown as 'issues'. This may cause inconvenience to users who are using Jira for tracking non bug items like drawings, plans, etc as they are not really 'issues'.

*Steps to replicate:-*

1) Create a Jira macro in Confluence.
 2) Invoke Jira issues(n number) using JQL or a filter
 3) The display always shows as n 'issues'.

*Suggested resolution:-*

Provide an option to configure the units for the items in Jira macro.
fields.summary: Provide facility to configure units instead of default 'issues' keyword  in Jira macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When opening the link to a resolved comment, if you try to scroll up or down the list of comments, it will jump back to the link location.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add some inline comments to a page on Confluence (~10)
 # Resolve them
 # Access *more actions (...) > Resolved Comments*.
 # Copy the link from a resolved comment and paste it on the URL.
 # Try to scroll down/up.

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to scroll down and up without any problem.
h3. Actual Results

The scroll location always go back to the position of the comment from the link.
h3. Workaround

Users can access the list of resolved comments by accessing *more actions > Resolved Comments* instead of opening the link.
fields.summary: When opening the link to a resolved comment, users are unable to scroll up or down
